DOCNAME: CASE OF CRUZ VARAS AND OTHERS v. SWEDEN
CONCLUSION: No violation of Art. 3;No violation of Art. 8;No violation of Art. 25-1
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants are Mr PERSON ( the first applicant ) , his wife PERSON ( the second applicant ) and their son PERSON , born in DATE ( the third applicant ) . All of the applicants are NORP citizens .
CARDINAL . The first applicant came to GPE on DATE and applied the following day for political asylum . He was joined there by the second and third applicants on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant was interrogated by ORG ( polismyndigheten ) of GPE as to his reasons for requesting political asylum . As regards his background in GPE he provided the following information . In DATE he became a member of ORG . He joined ORG in DATE and remained a member after the coup ORG in DATE as a result of which the coalition Government of President PERSON was replaced by the regime under the Presidency of General PERSON . In DATE he also became a member of ORG ( ORG ) of which he was the secretary until DATE and worked to create opposition against the PERSON régime . In DATE he was arrested and taken to a military camp where he was detained for DATE . He joined the NORP in DATE . DATE he remained passive politically . In DATE he moved to ORG and became involved in distributing leaflets for ORG . He participated in many demonstrations and CARDINAL general strikes ( DATE and DATE ) . He was arrested in DATE and DATE for breaking a curfew . He was also arrested in DATE by agents of the ORG ( ORG ) for having entered a prohibited area on a bicycle . He was released after TIME . Apart from these incidents he had been left alone by the NORP police and military . He gave as his reasons for leaving GPE the fact that he could not keep his house in ORG where he lived with his family and his poor financial situation resulting from lengthy periods of unemployment . He was not able to pay his mortgage and chose to sell the house to avoid an enforced sale .

CARDINAL . In a memorial to ORG ( statens invandrarverk - " the ORG " ) dated DATE the first applicant , through his legal counsel , commented upon the above interrogation . He stated that in DATE he had been arrested with CARDINAL friends and ill - treated . They were not allowed to sleep and were obliged to stand naked . CARDINAL of his friends was beaten on this occasion .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG decided to expel the applicants and prohibited them from returning to GPE before DATE without the ORG ’s permission . It also rejected the ORG requests for declarations of refugee status and travel documents . ORG considered that the applicants had not invoked sufficiently strong political reasons to be considered as refugees under LAW ( utlänningslagen , DATE : CARDINAL ) or the DATE LAW relating to ORG .

CARDINAL . The applicants appealed to the Government . The first applicant did not invoke any new circumstances . He pointed out that he did not receive all of the letters sent to him from GPE and could not therefore submit any documents from GPE in support of the appeal .
CARDINAL . The appeal was rejected by ORG ) on DATE .

CARDINAL.The applicants then alleged to ORG that there were impediments to the enforcement of the expulsion order and requested that their case be referred to ORG . The first applicant was interrogated by ORG on DATE . He stated that he had new reasons to invoke in support of his application for asylum . He considered that he ran the risk of political persecution , torture and possibly death , if he returned to GPE , because of his continued involvement in GPE with a political group known as LOC ( FPMR ) - a radical organisation that had tried to kill General PERSON . He had started to work for this group after his arrival in GPE . He feared that his activities in GPE which began in DATE and included the distribution of leaflets to support political prisoners in GPE would be known to the ORG .

CARDINAL . ORG decided on DATE to reject the ORG request and to enforce the expulsion decision by sending them by plane to GPE on DATE at TIME from FAC in GPE . An appeal against this decision was rejected by ORG on DATE . On DATE the applicants again requested that their case be transferred to ORG . On DATE ORG refused this request , and the applicants’ appeal against refusal was rejected by ORG . In his letter of appeal Mr PERSON , through a new legal counsel , stated that he had contributed signed articles in the FPMR newspaper ( ORG ) and had expressed himself critically about the regime in GPE . He also submitted a certificate by PERSON of the ORG support group dated DATE in which it was said that he and his family were politically active in the group . He further submitted copies of CARDINAL newspaper articles dated CARDINAL and DATE concerning a demonstration in LANGUAGE against the expulsion of the applicants . In these articles it was stated that Mr PERSON had hidden friends sought by the police in his house in GPE and that he was active for ORG in GPE .
CARDINAL . The expulsion decision could not be enforced as planned since the applicants did not appear in time for the scheduled departure .

CARDINAL . In a letter dated DATE to ORG the applicants again alleged that there were impediments to the enforcement of the expulsion order . On DATE Mr PERSON was interrogated by ORG in the presence of a new counsel . The official record of the interrogation contains the following passage ( translation from NORP ) :

" PERSON wishes especially to add to his statements the following information with regard to the punishments he has been subjected to in connection with his being held prisoner in GPE . Asked about the times and places of these imprisonments PERSON states that he was imprisoned the first time in GPE in DATE . He was arrested with all the others who were at the GPE office ( a large mining company ) on an occasion soon after the coup . They were taken to a military centre and badly treated . PERSON has not talked about this earlier because he was of the opinion that the police in GPE co - operate with the NORP police . He no longer holds this view .

Since the above - mentioned event lies far back in time PERSON was encouraged to begin his account by relating the most recent occasion on which he was subjected to persecution . He then stated that in DATE he was stopped when he was walking along a street called PERSON . It was then that CARDINAL men stepped out of a car and pulled him into a car which then drove to some sort of security building . During the journey he was hit in the ribs . He was taken down a long stairway and into some kind of investigation room . He was photographed after he had removed his clothes . He was hit , mainly on the head . He was hung up by his feet and photographed in this position . He was asked the whereabouts of PERSON but was unable to answer . PERSON was chairman of the free humanist thinkers . PERSON did not wish to relate more about the treatment on this occasion . He did however add that they told him that they were going to shoot him later the same day . He was blindfolded and after that he felt that someone was pressing the barrel of a weapon against his body but no shot was fired . Asked why they did this PERSON said that they gave as a reason that he was a NORP , which he has never been . After PERSON had been scared by the incident with the weapon he was released and after that was treated kindly by a man who was also present . The man told PERSON that things would be much better if he co - operated with the police . When asked if they were in a police station PERSON said that they were in a security building . They also mentioned to PERSON the names of the members of his family . At TIME he was driven away and was released after being held in custody for TIME . PERSON has not mentioned this incident earlier . Asked why he had not done so in spite of a number of police interrogations , numerous contacts with counsel and in spite of the fact that many documents with information about him had been submitted to the authorities , he replied that he had been betrayed many times earlier and he could not therefore trust anyone .

In DATE , he was somewhat uncertain about the exact date , PERSON was walking along a street in GPE after having attended a neighbourhood committee meeting . PERSON was on his way to catch a bus to GPE del Mar. CARDINAL men came in a car , threatened him with a knife against his throat and apprehended him . They were civilians in a civilian vehicle . They travelled in the direction of GPE del Mar. A black blindfold was placed over his eyes and then they took him out of the car and kicked him . PERSON protected himself as well as he could by putting his hands over his head and crotch . They insulted him too . They told him he should give up struggling against the Government . They said they knew of PERSON and that he ought to stop ; otherwise this could be DATE of his life . Even his family was threatened . These events took place in a building PERSON was taken to but he knows nothing about it because he was blindfolded . On this occasion he was subjected to torture through electric shocks against his testicles . He was even subjected to shocks by electrodes in the anus and testicles . After having been subjected to the above PERSON was driven a bit along the road between GPE and GPE del Mar before he was set free on this road . He was also near to being knocked down by a bus in connection with his being released from the car . The whole sequence of events took place within DATE TIME . DATE PERSON found his dog , DATE , dead under such circumstances that he suspected that it was the ORG or ORG [ ORG ] that lay behind it . The dog had been impaled on a metal fence that surrounded the house where PERSON lived . The conclusion PERSON drew was that he was subjected to this as a result of his activity in youth groups and friendship committees . PERSON had worked for a democratic development of GPE . Every time PERSON was arrested the ‘ police’ knew what he had been working for . The interrogation so far has been translated to PERSON who subsequently wished to point out that the committees were neighbourhood committees and not friendship committees and he also wanted to say that the reason why he did not trust anyone was just because the police knew so much about him when they held him in custody .

Without the presence of the interpreter or counsel , in accordance with ORG wishes , he stated that on the occasion when he was arrested by persons he thought were from the ORG in DATE he was also subjected to something else that he tried to suppress and which he finds very painful to talk about . After he had been tortured among other ways by electrodes in his anus and testicles , he was placed on a bed lying face down and his hands and feet were tied to bedposts . In this position CARDINAL or more men attacked him sexually . PERSON was at that point dazed from the previous treatment and can not therefore say with certainty if there was CARDINAL person . ( This section without the presence of the interpreter or counsel . PERSON can make himself understood in NORP . )

In addition PERSON has not been able to express the problems he has had as a probable result of the treatment he was subjected to . He has difficulties eating with cutlery made of metal . These problems manifest themselves with pains in his teeth on every occasion that his teeth come in contact with a metal object . This problem has become less intense but has been very intense earlier . It has thus been a question of CARDINAL different types of complaints . Firstly PERSON has experienced general pain in his teeth and secondly he has had problems with metal objects . PERSON first experienced the problem with his teeth after electric shock torture in DATE . He was subjected to this form of torture on a total of CARDINAL or CARDINAL occasions . After the torture in DATE PERSON also had many headaches . He has also noticed that since then he has had lapses of memory .

Otherwise PERSON has nothing more that he personally wishes to relate other than the above . When asked if he had anything to add on his political involvement he stated that he had already accounted for it but that he could now present new documents which support the previous statements . CARDINAL certificates were handed over . CARDINAL from PERSON , President of ORG in ORG , CARDINAL from PERSON , co - ordinator in the organisation of neighbourhood committees , as well as a certificate from ORG on the Rights of Young People .
The above was translated to PERSON who thereafter had no wish to refer to further details in the case . He has no objection to the above description ... . "

CARDINAL . The first certificate referred to in the record was dated DATE and consisted of a statement by the President of ORG ( ORG ) in ORG . It stated that Mr PERSON took part in the activities of that institution until he left GPE and that his psychological and physical integrity would be threatened if he were to stay in his home country . It further indicated that he was obliged to leave the country for political reasons . A second certificate of DATE by an official of ORG ) in GPE stated that he was persecuted by the dictatorship from DATE to DATE . He was active in the socialist youth group where he was the representative and leader of the revolutionary society for ORG " Artesanos de las Letras " ( Writers and ORG ) in ORG . The certificate also stated that he had been arrested in GPE in DATE and twice in PERSON in DATE and DATE ; that he was threatened with death in GPE in DATE ; that in DATE and DATE he was arrested by civilians and severely beaten . A third certificate dated DATE by ORG on the Rights of Young People ) in ORG contained similar statements .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG referred the question of the enforcement of the expulsion order to ORG . On DATE ORG decided that Mr PERSON should report to the police twice a week because of the danger that he would evade enforcement of the expulsion . By letter of CARDINAL DATE he submitted a medical opinion dated DATE to ORG issued by PERSON , an assistant researcher at ORG at ORG . Mr PERSON stated that PERSON had declared that he had been ill - treated in prisons in GPE and that he had shown a deformation of his upper left collar - bone , a scar on his left upper arm and a scar on the left of his chest .

CARDINAL . ORG referred the case to the Government on DATE , expressing the opinion that there was no impediment to the enforcement of the expulsion order . ORG found that Mr PERSON had the opportunity on several occasions to present his case to ORG and to it . However , on these occasions he had given contradictory information and had now radically changed his story . It concluded that even if it took into account the difficulties that a victim might have to describe what he had been subjected to there was no reason to believe his allegations .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr PERSON submitted a medical report to the ORG which had been prepared by a doctor of forensic medicine , PERSON . The report dated DATE stated , inter alia , as follows ( translation from NORP ) :

" The patient PERSON born on DATE has seen me on account of alleged torture in his home country . He has told a story which has been simultaneously interpreted and which is recorded in PERSON When examining the patient I have observed marks on the left collar - bone area and on the left upper arm which are referred to in the examination protocol ... .
In view of the above I make the following statement :

That the patient has said that he has been assaulted ; that he has , as objective evidence , shown , firstly , the marks of a collar - bone fracture following violence with a blunt instrument and , secondly , a typically rounded and colourless burn - mark on the inside of the left upper arm ( the wound has , according to forensic medical practice , the typical appearance of a burn caused by a hot pipe ) ; that he has subjective symptoms of troubles following genital torture , anal torture and sexual abuse in the anus ; that , when he describes this , he reacts , in my experience , in such a way ( crying , shaking ) that it has to be assumed that he has experienced this ; that , to summarise , nothing has been established which contradicts the assumption that PERSON has been subjected to such torture and sexual abuse as he alleges . "
Annex I gave the following information :

" The patient speaks about himself first and then about his father who was the secretary of ORG . They lived in the town of GPE in GPE . His father was arrested during the military coup in DATE and was brutally tortured and released after DATE . The patient was then DATE . He was also arrested and hit but , as he himself states , he was not directly tortured . They moved to the town of PERSON . The patient was also a member of ORG which is a party prohibited in GPE . The patient was persecuted during DATE . His own home was subject to a search in DATE . He was hit by the police and taken to a security building where his eyes were bandaged and he was hit by hands and was burnt on his left arm with a red - hot pipe . He participated in a demonstration against ... a coin which the ORG had introduced . He was arrested later and was tortured by electrification . In DATE he was subjected to such torture on his genitals . He was sodomised with an electrified rod which caused him great pain and one can see on the patient ’s face when he speaks of this torture that he was clearly in pain , he is near to tears . He was raped and sodomised several times which caused him to faint . He is very pained by telling this and his upper lip shakes and he perspires profusely . He has never told this to his wife and he now says ‘ I can not take it any more’ . The reaction is very typical of self - experienced humiliating sexual torture . Following a question the patient says that he has for a long time after this event had great problems of impotence . He thinks that it has been better in GPE . He takes vitamin E against these problems .

In DATE his dog was found dead , hanged on an iron fence which surrounded his house . There was a note stating that this would happen to all communists . It was signed by ORG which was the same as if it had been ORG . In DATE he therefore left GPE . I ask what would happen if he had to return to GPE . The patient is then very upset and says that he can not return and starts to cry ; he is convinced that they will arrest him at the airport and continue persecuting and torturing him . "

CARDINAL . A further medical opinion was produced in evidence prepared by PERSON , a specialist in psychiatric diseases at ORG . That opinion , dated DATE , stated that , from the manner in which he presented his story and his reactions while telling it , there were strong indications that he suffered from a post - traumatic stress syndrome . PERSON found him to be considerably shaken and on the borderline of what he could tolerate .
CARDINAL . The following description of the political activities of Mr PERSON was given by his lawyer in a letter to ORG of DATE :

" The appellant has been politically interested and active in different left - wing organisations ever since DATE and by DATE he was involved with ORG ( PERSON Izquierda Revolucionaria ) . During DATE he was active primarily in ORG . DATE he came into contact with people whom he believes belong to GPE PERSON . Together with these persons he has taken part in certain military activities .

As a result of his political work he was tortured in DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE . The reason why all these details are not found in the police interrogation is that the interrogation concentrated on events during DATE . However at the end of the interrogation it is mentioned that he had been tortured CARDINAL times .

When asked to account for his activity with the ‘ Front’ he stated the following : some time during DATE he made contact by chance with a person who was nicknamed the ‘ Gorilla’ because of his heavy build and hair growth . PERSON knew the PERSON from DATE when both of them were active in ORG . When they met again they had not seen each other for DATE but they immediately recognised each other . They met at a GPE meeting in a school in ORG which the Gorilla ’s daughters attended .

After a while his acquaintance with the Gorilla led to clear sabotage activities . The Gorilla held a senior post at the town ’s ORG . Hector has a knowledge of explosives after having worked in mining . Together they used explosive devices to destroy power lines around the town . They complemented each other well : the Gorilla indicated the targets and planned the operations , PERSON acquired the dynamite by travelling to the town of GPE where he has many childhood friends . He was able to buy dynamite from his friends who work in the mine . The dynamite was smuggled out by the workers . This activity continued until some time in DATE .

After this PERSON did not participate in any further sabotage operations since he felt he was under too much observation . However he believes that the PERSON continued the activities since they had a fairly large stock of dynamite . He has also read in the newspapers about power lines being sabotaged after he had discontinued the activity himself .

The Gorilla has tried in different ways to get him to participate in more advanced military projects . They have often discussed the possibility of trying to arm the populace and start a school for military training . They have drawn up detailed plans of how they would obtain weapons . These plans began as a discussion about ‘ how one could do even more ... ’ . Among other things concrete plans were drawn up on how to attack a carabineer barracks . The purpose of the attack would be to get hold of weapons which could later be used in other kinds of attacks . Nothing came of these plans because PERSON was arrested in DATE . During this arrest the police asked a wide range of questions ; inter alia , questions were asked about places which were to be meeting points for the participants in the attack . The attack against the carabineer barracks never took place . PERSON found out instead that another attack had been carried out against another carabineer barracks .

When asked to describe more details about the plan to attack , PERSON said that he and the Gorilla were to carry the stolen weapons to the churchyard and bury them there . When the time was right , the weapons were to be fetched from the churchyard by other persons .

The PERSON never mentioned Frente PERSON by name , but PERSON understood that the PERSON had a relatively central position in the organisation . The PERSON himself only mentioned that he was now active in ORG . As an example of the PERSON ’s central position PERSON mentioned that a short time before the assassination attempt against PERSON the PERSON asked PERSON if he would consider driving a lorry on a very important occasion . PERSON gave a hesitant reply and the suggestion was dropped . In retrospect PERSON has realised that it could possibly have been the vehicle that would be used on the occasion of the assassination attempt .

PERSON has not taken part in any direct military operations . On CARDINAL occasion however he was instructed to drive a lorry to a particular spot . He was to park the lorry there and then fetch another lorry . He was given no more information on that occasion . However this plan was cancelled for security reasons . Shortly thereafter PERSON read in a newspaper that an arms cache had been discovered right next to the place where he was to park the lorry .

DATE after he had met the Gorilla by chance , an old friend turned up with whom he had worked in a resistance cell in DATE in the town of PERSON . The friend immediately said that he was in trouble with the police and that he needed a place to hide . PERSON offered to give him shelter and they went straight back to PERSON ’s home . TIME CARDINAL other friends joined them , all CARDINAL armed with pistols . PERSON also thought he saw sub - machine guns of the kind used by the NORP police .

PERSON never found out why the friend was on the run ; as he said , ‘ it was better not to know ORG . DATE , on leaving PERSON ’s house , the friend was arrested . PERSON was informed of the arrest by an acquaintance who had previously seen PERSON with the friend who was in hiding . The CARDINAL other men fled from PERSON ’s house immediately .

After this PERSON moved to PERSON and supported himself as a construction worker . He remained in GPE between roughly DATE and DATE . He rented out his house through a fake owner and was informed that , shortly after , the house was searched and as a result of the search the tenants moved . The fake owner found new tenants to live in the house for the rest of the time . Since no further searches were carried out PERSON did not think it was dangerous to move back to ORG . Thus , in DATE , he returned there .

When asked about the numerous ‘ ORG occasions when he met people who can be assumed to belong to the ‘ Front’ , PERSON replied that he had also wondered about this . With regard to the Gorilla he felt it was pure chance that he met him . PERSON is more hesitant about the second friend . PERSON said that it could have been a chance encounter but that it could also have been a conscious attempt to bind him more firmly to the activities of the ORG . PERSON stated himself that because of his knowledge of explosives and as the owner of a remotely situated house he could be of interest to such an organisation as the ‘ Front’ .
When PERSON returned to ORG he felt he was being observed in different ways . He stated that he quite frequently encountered different types of salesmen who got in touch with him .

During CARDINAL of our conversations PERSON said suddenly ‘ there is something I have never talked about and something which I shall never PERSON . I insisted that he tell me . A psychological struggle took place which lasted TIME . I tried to maintain the initiative all the time and to motivate PERSON to tell his secret . PERSON defended his position and said ‘ I ’ll never say it , not even if I am expelled will I tell it . I ’ll only say it at the ORG .

Finally PERSON said that he had been in a poor state of mind for a long time in GPE and had taken large amounts of anti - depressants . After the torture of DATE his nerves have been strained to the point of breaking and because of the internal confession tradition in ORG he sought out the highest ranking leader in ORG with the rank of ORG President and told him everything .

He told him of his contacts with the PERSON and also about the CARDINAL other members of ORG whom he had introduced to the Gorilla . The conversations took place on several occasions . On the first occasion PERSON took the initiative and therefore related relatively little , then the ORG President took the initiative and obtained more details .

In DATE PERSON was arrested and tortured . When he left the torture chamber he tried to get in contact with the CARDINAL other members of ORG but they had both disappeared . He also tried to make contact with the Gorilla but he had also disappeared . PERSON is subjectively convinced that all CARDINAL are dead . He is also convinced that they have been killed as a result of his mistake in talking to the Grand President . PERSON believes that the ORG leader used his weak position and informed the Government about him and his friends .

PERSON can not say with certainty when the CARDINAL disappeared but says that the last time he met them was in DATE . The torture in DATE in combination with self - accusation at having caused the death of the PERSON and the CARDINAL NORP was a contributing factor to his leaving GPE a short while after that . "

CARDINAL . Medical reports drawn up by doctors in DATE hospital dated DATE and CARDINAL DATE concerning the welfare of PERSON ( the third applicant ) were also submitted to the Government . These reports stated that PERSON had personality problems and would in all probability suffer serious psychological harm if expelled from GPE .
CARDINAL . The first applicant also submitted a letter from the ORG High Commissioner for ORG for ORG dated DATE stating , inter alia , that :

" ... a person who has been exposed to torture will in most cases have lasting effects of both a physical and psychological / somatic nature . For this reason , we should operate neither with time limits nor with degrees of torture when assessing a torture victim ’s claim for refugee status . "
CARDINAL . In a letter of CARDINAL DATE , ORG wrote :

" Therefore we would like to point out that we believe that Mr PERSON ... should be protected against return to his home country ; apart from the many mental / traumatic / humanitarian aspects involved , we are of the opinion that not only LAW , but in particular the CARDINAL LAW should be emphasised . "

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr PERSON was taken into custody by ORG following a decision by ORG . The following day the Government ( ORG ) found that there was no impediment under LAW and CARDINAL of LAW to the enforcement of the expulsion order against the applicants .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG decided not to stop the expulsion and on DATE Mr PERSON was expelled to GPE . His wife and son , however , went into hiding in GPE . Their present whereabouts is not known to the ORG .

In DATE the state of emergency was lifted and in DATE exiles were allowed to return to GPE . On DATE the NORP people voted in a plebiscite to reject the candidacy of General PERSON as President of the country . Presidential and congressional elections were then scheduled for DATE . Following negotiations between the ORG and opposition groups a referendum was held on DATE resulting in the adoption of various constitutional amendments designed , inter alia , to render the presidential and congressional elections more democratic and reduce the continued influence of the armed forces in civilian life .

The presidential election took place on DATE resulting in the election of Mr PERSON , a member of the former opposition ORG and leader of a CARDINAL alliance entitled " Coalition of Parties for Democracy " .

CARDINAL . In DATE LAW ( DATE ) was published in the PERSON , the official gazette , thereby incorporating it into NORP law . The ORG also ratified in DATE LAW and other Cruel , Inhuman or Degrading Treatment or Punishment ( DATE ) and ORG and Punish Torture ( DATE ) although with reservations in both cases .
An ORG report of DATE , however , provides details of various cases of torture reported to ORG which allegedly occurred in DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr PERSON arrived at the airport in GPE ( GPE ) , where he applied unsuccessfully for asylum . He was then put on a plane for GPE where he arrived on DATE . He did not have any identity documents and when he came to passport control he was taken aside and photographed . He was required to sign a declaration to the effect that he had been in GPE for financial reasons and that he promised not to engage in any political activities in GPE .

CARDINAL . He remained in GPE from DATE and returned to his home in ORG . On CARDINAL and DATE he participated in political meetings , the latter in favour of the presidential candidate , PERSON . He alleges that on that occasion an unknown person approached him and threatened his family in GPE . During this period he claims that his brother - in - law was attacked in the street and badly injured by unknown persons . CARDINAL other brothers - in - law were stopped and searched by officials who asked them questions about him .

CARDINAL . On DATE he left GPE for GPE and lived for a time in GPE . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE the ORG rejected requests from Mr PERSON to be allowed to return to GPE . Although he was able to attend the hearing before the ORG , his present whereabouts are unknown to it .

CARDINAL . The Commission heard Dr PERSON as a witness on DATE . His evidence is summarised in detail in paragraphs CARDINAL of the Commission ’s report . He is an associate professor ( docent ) of forensic medicine ( rättsmedicin ) at ORG and also works with ORG assisting torture victims . He has DATE experience in assessing scars and wounds and has been working with allegations of torture from GPE since DATE .

CARDINAL . PERSON testified that there was a very high probability that the first applicant ’s story was true having regard to his wounds ( injury to collar bone and burn mark ) and his reactions when recounting his story . He spoke with considerable reluctance of the sexual torture he had experienced and sweated profusely . PERSON considered that such a reaction indicated that he had really experienced such treatment . He also exhibited great fear at the prospect of returning to GPE . PERSON pointed out that victims of sexual torture are often so damaged that they are not prepared to talk about it even to their husbands or wives .

CARDINAL . Following the expulsion of Mr PERSON the Government submitted a memorandum from ORG in GPE dated DATE which contains a report of an inquiry undertaken in accordance with a request from ORG for information regarding possible political activities of PERSON , and any political persecution to which he may have been exposed . The inquiry had been made on DATE by PERSON , Second Secretary at the ORG , during a visit to ORG , accompanied by , inter alia , the President of ORG . The report concludes that , as regards political activities , all the representatives of political parties who had been questioned had said that they do not know Mr PERSON . Neighbours who were questioned know him but were unaware of his involvement in any political activity .
In support of the above the Government have also submitted affidavits from ORG , ORG and the PERSON .

CARDINAL . As regards possible political persecution , the Government have submitted an affidavit by the President of ORG in ORG , PERSON , obtained by ORG in GPE . It appears from the affidavit that Mr PERSON is not known to the ORG and that consequently no persecution directed against him is known . The affidavit further states that the ORG has at its disposal complete registers of those who have disappeared , who have been tortured and who have been imprisoned in the fifth region of GPE since DATE .

CARDINAL . In the proceedings before ORG submitted a further affidavit from PERSON dated DATE in which she declared , inter alia , that Mr PERSON has no connections with any political party or with any trade union ; that there is no declaration registered at ORG in ORG regarding the detention of Mr PERSON ; that according to everyone who has been asked in the district where he lived he has never been politically active ; that in all the inquiries made directly with persons who have participated in clandestine activities , he is not known ; nor is he known by persons in prison in GPE for their role in similar activities ; that she was not aware of any explosions in ORG directed at railway lines and electric power lines which occurred in the period DATE as alleged by the first applicant ; that , following inquiries , he is not known by the various human rights bodies in FAC .

The Government also submitted an affidavit dated DATE by ORG FPMR which declared that Mr PERSON is not a representative of the organisation abroad and is not and never has been a combatant member of ORG . They further disclaimed all responsibility for any action he may have taken in the name of the FPMR .
CARDINAL . The applicants have submitted a medical report drawn up by PERSON ( ORG , ORG ) following an examination of the first applicant in DATE . The report includes the following statement :

" As a conclusion one may state that Mr PERSON suffers a serious ‘ post - traumatic stress disorder’ instilled in him as a consequence of the torture and ill - treatment suffered in GPE in DATE .
